options.D: Variable names should start with a numeric digit

questions.question: What will be the output of the following code?
Which statement about HashMap's resizing mechanism is correct?

options.A: HashMap doubles its size when the load factor exceeds 0.75 and rehashes all elements into new buckets
options.B: HashMap increases its size by 50% whenever an insertion operation would cause the load factor to exceed 0.75
options.C: HashMap doubles its capacity when the number of entries exceeds the product of the current capacity and the load factor, increasing to the next power of 2
options.D: HashMap resizes immediately after reaching exactly 75% of its capacity, regardless of the configured load factor

questions.question: Consider the following code. What is the most accurate statement about its execution?

options.A: The program will run faster because System.gc() forces immediate garbage collection, freeing memory after every 10000 iterations
options.B: The program might experience unpredictable pauses due to the frequent gc() calls, potentially making it slower overall
options.C: System.gc() guarantees that all objects marked for garbage collection will be collected before the next iteration
options.D: System.runFinalization() ensures all finalize() methods will be executed immediately, preventing memory leaks

questions.question: Which of the following statements about String immutability in Java is incorrect?

options.A: String immutability allows Java to optimize memory usage by maintaining a string pool
options.B: String immutability guarantees that once a String object is created, it cannot be modified, promoting thread safety
options.C: String immutability means every concatenation operation creates a new String object, which is why StringBuilder is more efficient for multiple concatenations
options.D: String immutability is implemented primarily through access control modifiers on fields, not through the final keyword on the String class itself

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid approach to resolve circular dependencies in Spring?

options.A: Using @Lazy annotation on one of the dependencies to delay its initialization
options.B: Using setter injection instead of constructor injection for one of the beans
options.C: Using constructor injection with @Qualifier annotations to specify the exact beans to inject
options.D: Creating a third bean that both dependent beans can use as an intermediary

options.C: The program deadlocks and never completes
options.D: T1 acquired lock1, T2 acquired lock2, T2 couldn't acquire lock1, Counter: 5

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a best practice for exception handling in Java?

options.A: Catch Exception at every method level to prevent exceptions from propagating up the call stack
options.B: Create custom exception classes that extend RuntimeException rather than Exception when the client should not be forced to handle the exception
options.C: Use empty catch blocks (catch and swallow) for most exceptions to prevent application crashes
options.D: Convert all checked exceptions to unchecked exceptions to simplify method signatures and make all code more concise

questions.question: What is the correct implementation of a global exception handler using @ControllerAdvice in Spring?

options.A: Option A - Using ResponseEntity with specific exception type
options.B: Option B - Using @ResponseStatus with return type
options.C: Option C - Using void return type with @ResponseStatus
options.D: Option D - Handling all exceptions in one method with type checking
